fractal

Class Layer

  • java.lang.Object
    • fractal.Layer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HistogramLayer, TriangleAverageLayer

    public abstract class Layer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a layer of a fractal. It will be asked to render in a specific way. Users can create their own layers and choose to use them from the GUI.
    Author:
    Calvin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      A description of the layer.

    • Field Detail

      • description

        public static java.lang.String description
        A description of the layer. It can be displayed as a tooltip in the Fractal modifier GUI

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(Palette palette,
                 int layer)
        initializes the layer. This should always be called before the layer is used.
        Parameters:
        palette - the palette the layer will use to color itself.
        layer - the layer level.

      • render

        public java.awt.Color[][] render()
        A render method that takes in a 2D array of pixels which represent the image. The layer will render itself to the array.
        Returns:
        the 2D array of colors representing the image rendered by this layer. Returns null if the layer is not visible.

      • setColorPalette

        public void setColorPalette(Palette palette)
        Used to change this layer's color palette
        Parameters:
        palette - the new color palette for this layer to use

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(Point location)
        Used to set the location of the Mandelbrot set that this layer renders
        Parameters:
        location - the new location of the Mandelbrot set

      • getBailout

        public long getBailout()
        Used to get the bailout value of the layer.
        Returns:
        the bailout value of the layer

      • setBailout

        public void setBailout(long newBailout)
        Used to change the bailout value of the layer.
        Parameters:
        newBailout - the new bailout value for the layer

      • getMaxIterations

        public int getMaxIterations()
        Used to get the maximum iterations of the layer.
        Returns:
        the maximum iterations of the layer.

      • setMaxIterations

        public void setMaxIterations(int maxIterations)

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(double zoom)
        Sets the zoom value of the layer and takes care of any stretching issues of the layer so that the fractal is never streched, regardless of the dimension of the image being drawn. It does based on the value of the longest edge.
        Parameters:
        zoom - the new zoom level of the layer

      • setScreenResolution

        public void setScreenResolution(java.awt.Dimension screenResolution)
        returns the resolution this layer renders at
        Parameters:
        screenResolution - the resolution this layer renders at

      • setLayer

        public void setLayer(int layer)
        This can be used to set the layer index of the layer. This is important because some rendering code will be different for layers with an index of 0 than all others.
        Parameters:
        layer - the new layer index for this layer

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        This can be used to set the name of the layer.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the layer

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        returns the name of the layer
        Returns:
        the name of the layer

      • getParameters

        public abstract Parameters getParameters()
        A method returning all editable parameters of the layer. When a layer is selected on the Layer view of the fractal gui, these parameters will be displayed to the use for modification
        Returns:
        the modifiable parameters

      • setParameters

        public abstract void setParameters(Parameters newProperties)
        Sets new values for the modifiable parameters
        Parameters:
        newProperties - the new values of the modifiable parameters

      • getPalette

        public Palette getPalette()
        returns the palette this layer uses to color the fractal
        Returns:
        the palette this layer uses to color the fractal

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Used to change the visibility of this layer
        Parameters:
        visible - the new visiblity of the layer

      • getVisible

        public boolean getVisible()
        Used to get the visibility of this layer
        Returns:
        the visibility of this layer

      • getOpacity

        public double getOpacity()
        Used to get the opacity of a layer
        Returns:
        the opacity of the layer

      • setOpacity

        public void setOpacity(double opacity)
        Used to change the opacity of the layer
        Parameters:
        opacity - the new opacity of the layer

      • initializeFractalRegistry

        public static void initializeFractalRegistry()
        This static method must be called at startup of the application if any Layers are to be used. It looks at the specified directory for all custom layer files, compiles them, and loads Class representations of them into the registry so they can be created later. If errors are thrown, it might be because a jdk is not being used. This method will only work if a jdk is installed

      • getLayerTypes

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLayerTypes()
        Returns a list of all valid layer types a user can choose from
        Returns:
        a list of all the valid layer types a user can choose from

      • isValidLayer

        public static boolean isValidLayer(java.lang.String type)
        Determines if a layer is a valid layer
        Parameters:
        type - a type of layer
        Returns:
        whether or not the type passed to this method corresponds to a real layer type

      • getLayerByType

        public static Layer getLayerByType(java.lang.String type)
        This method is used to get a new instance of a Layer, by type. For example, if "HistogramLayer" is passed to this method, it will return a new instance of a HistogramLayer.class, assuming that layer was initialized in the registry. It does not initialize the specific instance of the layer.
        Parameters:
        type - a type of layer
        Returns:
        an instance of the layer type requested, if it is a valid layer type. Otherwise, null.

      • getLayerByAddress

        public static Layer getLayerByAddress(java.lang.String address)
        This method is used primarily for loading in layers from a file. Given a file path, it will return the layer that file points to.
        Parameters:
        address - the file path of the layer to be created
        Returns:
        the layer the address points to

      • registerLayer

        public static boolean registerLayer(java.io.File file)
        Used to register a new layer type
        Parameters:
        file - a file pointing to the layer being registered
        Returns:
        whether or not the layer was succesfully registered. Returns false if the layer was already registered
